sen.j: 織田 長利（おだ ながとし）
sen.e: Nagatoshi ODA
Nagatoshi ODA
Nagatoshi ODA
Sengoku busho (military commander in the Warring State period)
A busho (military commander) of the Sengoku (Warring States) period.
A busho (military commander) of the Sengoku (Warring States) period.
Twelfth son of Nobuhide ODA
The twelfth son of Nobuhide ODA.
The twelfth son of Nobuhide ODA.
To be described in full details.
Described fully below.
Described fully below.
A peer who lived in the Meiji era
A peer who lived in the Meiji era.
The peerage who lived in the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: the peerageに用語を統一しました。Eraをperiodに変更しました。

sen.e: The sixteenth family head of the Naonaga's line of the Oda family
The sixteenth family head of Naonaga's line of the Oda family.
The sixteenth family head of Naonaga's line of the Oda family.
Second son to Hidezane ODA
The second son of Hidezane ODA.
The second son of Hidezane ODA.
Viscount
Viscount.
Viscount.
His wife was a daughter of Naokazu NABESHIMA
His wife was a daughter of Naokazu NABESHIMA.
His wife was a daughter of Naokazu NABESHIMA.

sen.j: 織田 長利（おだ ながとし、生年不詳－1582年7月21日（天正10年6月2日 (旧暦)））は、戦国時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Nagatoshi ODA (Year of birth not known - July 21, 1582) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku Period (period of warring states)(Japan)
Nagatoshi ODA (Year of birth not known - July 21, 1582) was a busho in the Sengoku Period.
sen.cmt: Deleted translations of Japanese terms as they appear in cell F5Punctuation
sen.e: Nagatoshi ODA (Year of birth unknown - July 1, 1582) was a busho in the Sengoku Period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。not knownをunknownにしました。

sen.j: 織田信秀の十二男で、その末子。
sen.e: The twelfth and last son of Nobuhide ODA
He was the twelfth and last son of Nobuhide ODA.
He was the twelfth and the last son of Nobuhide ODA.
sen.cmt: lastの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.e: His popular name was Matasaburo.
His popular name was Matasaburo.
His popular name was Matasaburo.
He was the youngest brother of Nobunaga ODA.
He was the youngest brother of Nobunaga ODA.
He was the youngest brother of Nobunaga ODA.

sen.j: 生母は一説では岩室殿（信秀の最後の側室）とされる。
sen.e: In a certain view, his mother was Iwamurodono (Nobuhide's last concubine)
There is a theory that his mother was Iwamurodono (Nobuhide's last concubine).
One theory has it that his mother was Iwamurodono (Nobuhide's last concubine).
sen.cmt: 一部、翻訳を変更しました。

sen.j: すぐ上の兄は織田長益（有楽斎）。
sen.e: His elder brother immediately before him was Nagamasu ODA (Urakusai).
His elder brother was Nagamasu ODA (also known as Urakusai).
His closest elder brother was Nagamasu ODA (also known as Urakusai).

sen.j: 津田姓を称していたため、津田長利と呼ばれることもある。
sen.e: As he used the family name of Tsuda, he also called Nagatoshi TSUDA.
As he used the family name of Tsuda, he was also called Nagatoshi TSUDA.
As he used the family name of Tsuda, he was also called Nagatoshi TSUDA.

sen.j: 兄・信長の命で織田信忠の軍団に配属し、1574年の伊勢国長島一向一揆討伐に参加した。
sen.e: According to his elder brother, Nobunaga's order, he belonged to Nobutada ODA's corps and took part in the war to subjugate Nagashima ikko ikki (an uprising of Ikko sect followers) in 1574.
On the orders of his elder brother, Nobunaga, he joined Nobutada ODA's forces and, in 1574, took part in the Seiges of Nagashima in Ise Province (an uprising of Ikko sect followers).

On the order from his elder brother, Nobunaga, he was assigned to Nobutada ODA's forces and took part in the suppression of Ise Nagashima Ikko Ikki (an uprising of Ikko sect followers in Nagashima, Ise Province) in 1574.
sen.cmt: 一部、翻訳を変更しました。

sen.j: 1581年、京都御馬揃えでは信長の一族衆として参加している。
sen.e: In Kyoto Umazoroe (military parade) in 1581, he took part in as a family member of Nobunaga.
He partcipated in the Kyoto Umazoroe (military parade) in 1581 as a member of Nobunaga's family.
He took part in the Kyoto Umazoroe (military parade) in 1581 as a member of Nobunaga's family.
sen.cmt: took part inに変更しました。

sen.j: 1582年、明智光秀が本能寺の変を起こして兄・信長を殺したとき、長利は信忠と共に二条城で明智軍に攻められ、戦死した。
sen.e: When Mitsuhide AKECHI caused Honnoji Incident in 1582 and killed Nagatoshi's elder brother, Nobunaga, he was attacked and killed in the Nijo-jo Castle together with Nobutada.
In 1582, Mitsuhide AKECHI caused the Honnoji Incident in which he killed Nobunaga, Nagatoshi's elder brother, and then attacked and killed Nagatoshi and Nobutada at Nijo-jo Castle.
In 1582, Mitsuhide AKECHI caused the Honnoji Incident in which he killed Nobunaga, Nagatoshi's elder brother, and then attacked and killed Nagatoshi and Nobutada at Nijo-jo Castle.
